title: ‘The Flight Attendant’ Review: Taking Off From Reality
sub_head: A flight attendant struggles to return to the real world after waking up in a hotel room in Thailand and discovering a grisly scene.
body: It’s not hard to see potential in “The Flight Attendant” (begins Thursday, HBO Max), which opens with Cassie (Kaley Cuoco), the stewardess of the title, waking up in a hotel room in Bangkok to discover a blood-drenched male corpse on the other bed. Terrified, she calls a close friend in New York to gasp out hysterical questions about the famous Amanda Knox case, and about the perils of facing a murder trial in a foreign country—Thailand, no less—whose justice system and standards of evidence bear small resemblance to the sort Americans are accustomed to. She has reason for her panic, especially since she was moved to...
